intro: Acrocephalus goetzei, commonly known as the Goetze's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, narrow leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that produce wind-pollinated flowers. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wet meadows and marshy areas. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–100 cm and is known for its resilience in wetland ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland biodiversity.
